item.content:encoded:
Work Study refers to some on-campus jobs that are sponsored through Financial Aid and Awards.

Students interested in applying to Work Study jobs must complete the Student Financial Profile, found on MyCampus (under the student tab). Once approved for the program, start applying for the on-campus jobs listed under the Work Study Jobs tab of the Hired Portal.Â  Detailed information on this employment program can be found on the Hired portalor MyCampus.

Please note: not all on-campus job opportunities require students to complete a student financial profile.Â  The Student Association, Aramark, Residence, and Athletics, Student Academic Learning Services and other college departments have hired students for part-time and summer work.

Check out on-campus and off-campus job leads online through the Hired portal. Log on using your MyCampus login information.

item.content:encoded:
Coordination of Benefits

Benefits under the two plans can be coordinated to increase your coverage up to a total of 100% of the actual expense(s) incurred.Â  For example, the student would submit for reimbursement under the student plan and submit any outstanding balance to the secondary plan for consideration.

Opting Out of the Plan

You may decline coverage for Dental and a portion of the Extended Heath coverage by completing the on-line opt out form (see dates below). Prescription drug coverage and Accidental Death and Dismemberment coverage are both mandatory. You must provide proof of similar coverage elsewhere (i.e. as a dependent under your parentâ€s or spouseâ€s insurance).Â  You will be asked the name of the insurance company, policy number and the name of the subscriber.

Print off the confirmation you receive and keep it as proof that you opted out.Â  If there is any discrepancy between the student and student insurance plan you will be required to provide the confirmation.

item.title: Can I do a PLAR over again?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: The PLAR process can only be initiated once per course.
item.content:encoded: The PLAR process can only be initiated once per course.

item.title: Is it possible to have an unsuccessful outcome?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Yes.Â If there is insufficient evidence that the course learning outcomes have been met, the PLAR application will be deemed unsuccessful.Â You will not receive a failing grade for an unsuccessful assessment.

item.title: Are all subjects eligible for PLAR?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Not all subjects are eligible for PLAR.Â Subject eligibility for PLAR is noted in the course outline.

item.title: What will I need to complete?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Students must demonstrate knowledge of course learning outcomes with an assessment method that includes one or more of the following: Written test/examination. An assignment or essay. Submission of a portfolio. An oral/videotaped presentation. Observation/demonstration of skills. A presentation board. Assessment methods are determined by subject matter experts.
item.content:encoded:
Students must demonstrate knowledge of course learning outcomes with an assessment method that includes one or more of the following:

  • Written test/examination.
  • An assignment or essay.
  • Submission of a portfolio.
  • An oral/videotaped presentation.
  • Observation/demonstration of skills.
  • A presentation board.

Assessment methods are determined by subject matter experts.
